DOC.brief_summary: The overall objective Dietary Protein Insulin Sensitivity Study test hypothesis increase protein diet reduce carbohydrate ( 35 % energy ) ameliorate insulin resistance absence weight loss , effect independent saturate fat content . Moreover , test whether diet result beneficial change total LDL cholesterol , small , dense LDL , HDL cholesterol also independent saturate fat intake .
DOC.detailed_description: Insulin resistance major metabolic disturbance associate excess adiposity contribute atherogenic dyslipidemia predispose cardiovascular disease type 2 diabetes mellitus . The effect insulin resistance change dietary macronutrient composition absence weight loss poorly understood . To good understand effect , study men woman insulin resistance 4 week basal diet ( 15 % protein , 55 % carbohydrate , 30 % fat ) 4 week random assignment basal diet one 4 diet 35 % carbohydrate either 20 % 30 % protein , either 7 % 15 % saturate fat . At end dietary period ( 4 week 8 week ) , draw blood sample detail metabolic measurement measure insulin sensitivity frequently sample intravenous glucose tolerance test ( FSIGT ) method . In addition insulin resistance , assess effect dietary composition parameter atherogenic dyslipidemia .
DOC.criteria: Body mass index ( BMI ) ≥ 27 ≤ 40 kg/m2 HOMAIR ≥ 2.5 Nonsmoking Total cholesterol LDL cholesterol < 95th percentile sex age Fasting triglycerides < 500mg/dl Fasting blood sugar < 126 Urinary microalbumin < 30 mg/L Normal thyroid stimulate hormone level Hematocrit ≥ 36 % Blood pressure < 150/90 At least 3 month weightstable state ( ± 5 lb ) prior study . During study , subject require maintain body weight within ± 3 % ( maximum change 5 lb ) initial weight course consecutive two week second week baseline diet last week diet phase History coronary heart disease , cerebrovascular disease , peripheral vascular disease , bleed disorder , liver renal disease , diabetes , lung disease , HIV , cancer ( skin cancer ) last 5 year Use drug know affect lipid metabolism insulin resistance , hormone , blood thinning agent , warfarin Use alcohol dietary supplement study Pregnancy
